question: Question_01_(f)
statement:
Which of the following is essentially a form of the Fundamental Theorem
of Calculus?

i. The area under the graph of $\displaystyle f(x)$ between
$\displaystyle x=a$ and $\displaystyle x=b$ is given by
$\displaystyle \int_{a}^{b}f(x)\,dx$

ii.
$\displaystyle \int_{a}^{b}f(x)\,dx =\lim_{n \to \infty}\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}f(x_{k})\Delta x$

iii. The derivative with respect to time of the position of a molecule
is \emph{v}. The net displacement of the molecule from
$\displaystyle t=0$ to $\displaystyle t=T$ is given by
$\displaystyle \int_{0}^{T}v(t)\,dt$

iv. $\displaystyle \int_{a}^{b}f(x)\,dx = f'(b) - f'(a)$
